alert.note: Alert for Labette; Montgomery; Neosho; Wilson (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 28 at 6:46AM CDT by NWS Wichita
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Wilson, Labette, southwestern Neosho and northeastern Montgomery Counties through 715 AM CDT... At 646 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Neodesha to near Edna. Movement was east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph, pea size hail, torrential rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Parsons, Neodesha, Cherryvale, Oswego, Chetopa, Altamont, Thayer, Edna, Mound Valley, Galesburg, Bartlett, Labette, Parsons Tri City Airport, Lake Parsons, Angola, Dennis and Big Hill Lake. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
